description_short.en-US: This relaxing interior scene shows how to create a photorealistic render with Redshift.

description_long.en-US: The subtle textures of the blue sofa, the reflective surfaces of the modern decor, and the realistic lighting all combine to create a cozy living space. Use this scene as a reference for how to achieve photorealistic rendering in Redshift.

description_short.en-US: These falling pillows bounce and interact for pure visual delight. Demonstrates how simulation can drive a scene.

description_long.en-US: This scene makes extensive use of C4D's simulation system. Cloth simulation is used to render plush shapes as they fall into place and bounce against rigid boy colliders in the floor and walls. See the project annotation for instructions on how to cache the simulation for optimal playback.

title_text.en-US: How to Model with Basic Shapes

description_short.en-US: In this scene you will learn how to model the eye of a robot using primitive shapes.

description_long.en-US: The most basic and fundamental modelling method is to model with primitive shapes. Our in-app tutorial will guide you through all the steps needed to add an eye, lens and materials to complete this robot model.

description_short.en-US: Particles are animated along the path of a spline to create this effect with stunning fluid dynamics.

description_long.en-US: In this scene, particle emission and behavior is driven by a text spline. You can easily edit the text to customize it for your own needs, or replace the text with a spline of your choice. See the project annotation for instructions on how to cache the particles and render with motion blur.

title_text.en-US: How to use Dome Lights & HDRIs

description_short.en-US: Learn how to quickly and easily add realistic light your scene with the Dome Light and HDRIs.

description_long.en-US: Like a sky that surrounds the entire scene, the Dome light simulates light emitting from a large sphere. This is one of the fastest and easiest ways to provide natural, realistic lighting to your scene - especially when used with a HDR image.

description_short.en-US: Subtle lighting, minimalist models and lovingly crafted materials show off ray trace rendering in Redshift.

description_long.en-US: See how C4D and Redshift could elevate minimalism for stunning results. Simple shapes and light combined with a linear camera movement are sometimes all you need to captivate an audience and tell your story.

description_short.en-US: See the particle system in action as an army of archers launches their attack in the distance.

description_long.en-US: This scene uses the stick modifier to stick the arrow particles to the ground for a feeling of real impact. A cloner object is used to set up the geometry and individual animation of the arrows as they hit their mark. See the project annotation for instructions on how to cache the particles and render with motion blur.

title_text.en-US: How to Add Assets to Your Scene

description_short.en-US: In this lesson you will learn how to create your own scenes using the Asset Browser and Place Tool.

description_long.en-US: The asset browser contains thousands of models, material, HDRIs and more for our subscribers to quickly create their own scenes. See how easily you can set up and position 3D objects using the Place tool and unlock the potential of the asset browser.
A basic template for small-medium scale object rendering on a white background. Includes lights, backdrop and camera. Just replace the model in this template to get started.
A basic template for large size showroom object renders. Includes multiple camera & light setups to give you options for shots and moods. Just replace the model in this template to get started.

A standard 3 point lighting setup ready to use for any purpose where cinematic lighting is needed. Just replace the model in this template, or copy/paste the lights into your own scene to get started.
